Description: ear- or hair-ring and two beads made of different material. A: Fragment of an ear-ring made of red jasper. The section is triangular and there are small incised strokes forming a ribbed edge. The outer surface is very well polished, the inner face shows very fine drilling lines. B: Disc-shaped bead made of ostrich eggshell, well smoothed and well finished. C: Spherical bead made of glazed material in a pearlescent colour.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
